answers.author: Adam Carpenetti
answers.text:
Are these apps for business use or personal?  Several years ago, we chose Blackberries as our smartphone.  With a Blackberry Enterprise Server, we have the ability to lock down the device to only install approved applications.  We previously ran into some issues with spyware and beta applications that would cause issues with the phone and then IT needed to provide support.  As for how to do this on iOS or Android devices, I cannot answer.
We do not have any official policy for smartphones, but it does fall under our computer-use policy about unapproved software installation being prohibited.

author: Andrea Phillips
text: Can you share any policies you are aware of regarding downloading of apps onto city-owned smartphones? Our city is looking at buying Smartphones for certain employees and we are looking for policies governing their use.
title: Smartphones-city policy on downloading apps?
